docs.snippet: This week’s newsletter looks at Australia’s struggle to define where it stands with China, and why the debate has become so intense.

docs.snippet: While aging most wines is unnecessary, a few, like this Loire white, will improve. Still, much can be gained from sampling them while young.

headline.main: For Savennières, Age Comes With Benefits

docs.snippet: Pedro Quezada, who won $338 million in 2013, was charged with sexual assault. His lawyer said his accuser had fabricated the charges to get his money.

headline.print_headline: New Jersey Man Who Won Millions in Powerball Lottery Is Accused of Molesting Girl
headline.main: New Jersey Man Who Won Millions in Powerball Lottery Is Accused of Molesting Girl

docs.snippet: The Dallas sportscaster Dale Hansen has become a viral video star for his sometimes controversial commentaries. He just wants you to hear him out.

headline.print_headline: In Deeply Conservative Texas, a Folksy Voice of Progressivism
headline.main: The Progressive Voice Bursting From Texas and Spreading Everywhere

docs.snippet: The London artist Archy Marshall purposefully pulled back from underground fame — and recording with Kanye West — ahead of his new album, “The Ooz.”

headline.main: King Krule, a Cult Singer in the Making, Is Setting the Terms Himself

docs.snippet: A growing body of evidence shows that college students generally learn less when they use computers or tablets during lectures. That is probably true in workplace meetings, too.

headline.print_headline: Take Notes With Pen and Paper? It Can Be Done
headline.main: Laptops Are Great. But Not During a Lecture or a Meeting.
